"I'll go with your warriors," you answer. "Very well," says Alton. "You will stay withTomo. Vivaldi taught him English, and he will tellyou what you need to know."Immediately one of the Rakas steps forwardand takes your arm. "I am Tomo," he says. Thenhe leads you to the outskirts of the village andinto his agon. He brings you woven mats. "Youmust rest now," he says. You peer outside at the red-streaked sky."Doesn't it ever get dark here?" "We have no night or day," says Tomo. "Wemeasure time by the tides of the Great River. Dr.Vivaldi said two of our tides equal one of yourdays. It is sleeping tide now." You realize that you have not slept since youarrived in the Underground Kingdom. How longhave you been here? How many tides? Too tiredto think about it, you lie down and quickly fallasleep
